column4: how do i set cc environmant variable to the name of the compiler???
it should be already set up for your default compiler... Do you have one installed?
type 'gcc' in terminal and see what that tells you...
looks like gcc is installed, then. are you trying to build anything from source?
im trying to install nvidia drivers
nvidia support should be available 'out of the box' in ubuntu. do you need specific drivers?
and when i enter 2 installitin he tells me gcc are not the same version
i allready tryed a few manuals from ubuntu forums but non of them worked...
I really have no personal expertise with nvidia or 3D acceleration, sorry.
hhh thats ok thnx enyway maybe u can give my a direction on what i shouled do next to set cc environment?
I'd 'sudo aptitude install gcc make' just to make sure you have the 'basic kit'.
